data.message: Oh, hey, are we doing support here? Can someone help me with something?

replies.message: Hi Alina. This is a great place to ask questions. How can we help? -William

Cool! Hi Will, okay so I have two different groups right? One as part of the various groups within my university. It's searchable within that which is nice, it has maybe 50 people in it. I also have another group that's public and open, which has maybe 300 people in it. The issue is, they're for the same club and it's prone to fragmentation / confusion, is there some way I can merge the two?

Hi Alina. It's currently not possible to merge two groups. I'd recommend notifying everyone in the group you want to stop using that you'll be using the other group going forward. I would also suggest providing your feedback to the groups product team through this form: http://bit.ly/2qpMjPF. Hope that helps! -William
Facebook Alright, related to that, is it possible to link a university-based group to a public page? I noticed it worked with the public group perfectly fine but does it for the Uni one too?
